DataElement.preferredName: Person Clinical Trial CLL Response Stratification Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The tumor response type of a person a with chronic lymphocytic leukemia, the most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia, and comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States, as criteria for participating in the type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Clinical Trial CLL Response Stratification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the process of classifying patients by response (any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent) participating in the type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people with chronic lymphocytic leukemia, the most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia, and comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States.

Property.preferredDefinition: A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical study.:The most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia, and comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States.  Morphologically, the neoplastic cells are small, round B-lymphocytes.  The clinical course is indolent, but this type of leukemia is not considered to be curable with available therapy. (WHO, 2001) -- 2003:Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.:The process of classifying patients into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

Concepts.definition: A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical study.

The most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia.  It comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States.  Morphologically, the neoplastic cells are small, round B-lymphocytes.  This type of leukemia is not considered to be curable with available therapy. (WHO, 2001)
Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.
The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the protocol stratification factors based on CML response.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having been established or verified.: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: User created long name for DCI, Modified RANO, ghd, 04.24.18

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Remission with persistent lymphoid nodules in the bone marrow

Concepts.definition: Remission with persistent lymphoid nodules in the bone marrow.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A decrease in the size of a tumor, or in the extent of cancer in the body, in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: A decrease in the size of a tumor, or in the extent of cancer in the body, in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.: Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.
A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

DataElement.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
